channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outise number 26, 18th September
item.description:
Young rate tree need re-staking or fixing the current stakes. one of the stakes has completely come of the ground and and the other is very wobbly. with the wind the young tree is leaning down. it needs re-staking urgently or else most likely it will fail and collapse

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Belsize Square, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 18th September
item.description:
Fox was hit and killed in the road Iâ€™ve picked her up and placed her in leaves on the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (3), 18th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HUMAN: RED ROUTE Oxford St & side streets 20 Sept onwards, 18th September
item.description:
Westminster council has handed over Oxford Street & at least part of the side streets, the roads, to Transport for London. Takes effect Saturday 20 Sept. 2025. Reporting road problems, we can use the tfl tool: streetcare.tfl.gov.uk. Can we also still report Oxford St road issues to FixmyStreet?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 400, Oxford Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree down on the pavement, 18th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Road, Coldblow, London

item.title: Broken Road Sign, 18th September
item.description:
As seen in the photo the road sign is broken and not visible for cars coming down the road, causes a trip hazard for both pedestrians and vehicles. Have reported this weeks ago and still not fixed. Also causes sounds of scraping in the wind, needs to be fixed asap please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, Consort Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 18th September
item.description:
This is not the first sign this has happened where rubbish has been dumped at the corner of Wickham Road and Chancery Lane. Can you please speak to the labour office at the corner of Wickham road / Chancery Lane? They have CCTV videos where you can identify the individual who is dumping this rubbish thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Wickham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: School street road closure bollards have been filled in, 18th September
item.description:
Two of the school street bollards used to temporarily close Siebert Road in the morning and afternoon during term time, have been filled in. Tarmac has been used to cover where the bollard should be and as a result cars now freely enter Siebert and Invicta Roads when children are walking to and from school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siebert Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle and musical instrument case dumped in Cator Park, Beckenham, 18th September
item.description:
Bicycle and musical instrument (double base!) case dumped in Cator Park, Beckenham. Dumped deep behind bushes in South West corner of Cator Park near Aldersmead Road and to the rear of 19 Eastwell Close. Note well hidden and not obvious from distance. (Found when dog walking).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldersmead Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
